CMPTGCS 1A.title: Computer Programming and Organization I
CMPTGCS 1A.comments: May be repeated for credit to a maximum of 12 units.
CMPTGCS 1A.description: Introduction to computer science, programming, algorithms and data structures.

CMPTGCS 1B.title: Computer Programming and Organization II
CMPTGCS 1B.comments: May be repeated for credit to a maximum of 8 units.
CMPTGCS 1B.description: Object oriented programming, operating systems, scripting and assembly languages, graphical user interfaces.

CMPTGCS 1L.title: Programming Laboratory
CMPTGCS 1L.prereq_description: Consent of instructor. Concurrent enrollment in Creative Studies-Computer
CMPTGCS 1L.description: Laboratory offering hands on Unix and other operating system experience. Small to large scale software development projects.

CMPTGCS 2.title: Foundations of Computer Science
CMPTGCS 2.comments: May be repeated for credit to a maximum of 8 units.
CMPTGCS 2.description: Mathematical foundations of computer science, including sets, relations, functions, logic and combinatorics.

CMPTGCS 5.title: Group Studies
CMPTGCS 5.description: Student-directed discussion and study in a variety of subjects within Computing.

CMPTGCS 10.title: Computer Science Colloquium
CMPTGCS 10.description: Students receiving credit will present talks in their field on material arranged in consultation with the instructor. Credit assigned by the instructor will reflect the extent and quality of participation.

CMPTGCS 20.title: Special Topics in Computer Science
CMPTGCS 20.description: Lectures on a coherent body of computer science topics which are not usually presented in standard computer science courses.

CMPTGCS 130A.title: Advanced Topics in Computer Science
CMPTGCS 130A.description: Advanced topics course for advanced undergraduates, covering topics not offered in standard computer science courses, combining research orientation and current developments and technologies. A. Distributed and Network Computing.

CMPTGCS 130E.title: Advanced Topics in Computer Science
CMPTGCS 130E.description: Advanced topics course for advanced undergraduates, covering topics not offered in standard computer science courses, combining research orientation and current developments and technologies. E. Programming Languages, Systems and Technologies.

CMPTGCS 130G.title: Advanced Topics in Computer Science
CMPTGCS 130G.description: Advanced topics course for advanced undergraduates, covering topics not offered in standard computer science courses, combining research orientation and current developments and technologies. G. Software Systems and Technologies.

CMPTGCS 130H.title: Advanced Topics in Computer Science
CMPTGCS 130H.description: Advanced topics course for advanced undergraduates, covering topics not offered in standard computer science courses, combining research orientation and current developments and technologies. H. General.

CMPTGCS 140.title: Projects in Computer Science
CMPTGCS 140.description: Projects in computer science for advanced undergraduates. Students work with a faculty member on a research or creative project with the consent ofacademic advisor.

CMPTGCS 199.title: Independent Studies
CMPTGCS 199.comments: May be repeated for credit. Creative Studies students may enroll in a maximum of 24 units of Independent Studies courses per year, with a maximum of 45 units counted toward graduation.
CMPTGCS 199.description: Serious independent study in computer science with consenting faculty member.
